p: We first investigated the overall reactivity of CD4 T cell responses to peptides derived from the WN virus structural proteins, the capsid C, membrane prM/M and envelope E ( Figure 1A). PBMC samples from WN virus-infected individuals were depleted of CD8-positive cells and tested in IL-2 ELISPOT assays with pools of overlapping 15 mer peptides that cover the entire sequence of each of the structural proteins. The study population consisted of 29 subjects (18 asymptomatic/11 WND patients; age range 27–70 years) ( Table 1), recruited at a mean of 40 ± 6 days after diagnosis. In terms of the overall magnitude, highest responses were elicited by E peptides, which accounted for 57% of the total response, followed by C and prM peptides, which accounted for 29 and 14% of the total response, respectively ( Figures 1B,C). In contrast, none of the flavivirus-naïve individuals showed a response to any of the C, prM and E peptides, confirming the specificity of this assay ( Figure 1B).
